website_summaries.verdict: Best for occasional use. We recommend the Cuisipro if you plan on using a food mill regularly.
pros: Three stainless steel milling discs prevent pulp and skins from slipping through
Effortlessly mashes and sieves soft foods
cons: Requires excessive amount of grinding to remove juice and liquids

customer_reviews.title: Sooo very awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this little bugger is sooo great! A must have, especially if you cook and/or bake with fruit that has tiny seeds! - Has made my life so much easier. - (Side note) the directions say to turn the crank counter clockwise as a standard and only clockwise when going in reverse to dislodge food; I find the opposite to work better, clockwise as the standard and counter clockwise for when needing to reverse, but again a GREAT little kitchen helper. LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Augestina M. P.

customer_reviews.title: poor design blade dont contact
customer_reviews.text: you never know sometimes with both good and bad reviews, i bought it. it is poorly designed. the blades dont make contact with the perforated cone, about a 1/8" gap, and food slides right under it. absolutely no chance of it de-skinning and or de-seeding. junk...
customer_reviews.author: ERIC BROOKS

customer_reviews.title: and like that I can switch the plates
customer_reviews.text: I used it once. It did alright while it lasted. I think it is designed well, and like that I can switch the plates, however... I hand washed and dried the thing, but still ended up rusting. Cons: *Rusts after single use Pros: *Does what it's suppose to *I thought it was very well designed (exchangeable plates, comfortable hand crank, and narrowing pot that fits into bowls)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific piece of gear. Versatile and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to grind dehydrated spice blends. I had a cheaper one that fell apart under the abuse. This one has already lasted longer and is in great shape despite the heavy use. Great ergonomics. Even grinding the most crystalline products go through easily and come out consistently. One caveat: There are no spreadable legs (which break on other mills) so you have to have a bowl the right diameter to work conveniently. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Steve M. Fye

customer_reviews.title: No good for baby food
customer_reviews.text: The baby food this creates is lumpy, even with the smallest filter. This is not useful to me. For people who say it just pushes the food around, try turning it the other way. If you rotate in one direction, it just pushes the food around. If you rotate it in the other direction it'll push food through.
customer_reviews.author: iq

customer_reviews.title: Shiny P.of.S!
customer_reviews.text: If u like pushing food around a Mill with zero yield, THIS Shiny POS is for you! Tried everything, read everything. My purpose was Tomato skin and seed removal, but they do NOT catch, not even a little. Tried all 3 screens too, w/ different tomatos... ¡NADA! IM IN WONDER of the positive reviews??? My item was not defective or installed incorrectly, Nor Operator Error.... i checked w Manufacturer Videos. The 1/8 gap between Blade and Screen, it Supposed to b that way, fine, but the holes never get traction enough to lock the food to b mashed. High Hopes = DASHED! “Next!”
customer_reviews.author: Jack D. Lenzo

customer_reviews.title: but works great for most other thing I have used it for
customer_reviews.text: Inefficient for tomatoes, but works great for most other thing I have used it for. I do wish they had a special berry screen, as some blackberry seeds sneak by. Part of the is around the edge, so that is it's main flaw, but overall very few seeds. Good product for the price, already have to years and entering third. Certainly cheaper than a Squeezo, if a bit limited.
customer_reviews.author: jacob vance

customer_reviews.title: Consider using a blender
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used one of these before. So this was my first time with this type of equipment. I hated it. I’d rather eat the peels and get more fiber then take the time to try to push it to the strainer. I thought having this type of device would speed things up but it did not for me. In the end I Cut out the cores cooked the apples put it all in my ninja blender. Applesauce comes out beautiful color this way because of the skins
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. It doesn't remove all the baby seeds but it does remove most all tomato seeds from the sauce, I have had a lot of tomatoes to do this year and my arms are not tired out after doing several loads a day like the were with a traditional sieve going around and around. It's easy to use and very easy to clean, just put it in the dishwasher and your done.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Handsome, easy-to-use and is a good size. The finest mesh removed some but not all raspberry seeds for my jam. I usually put about half of my berries through a mill and leave the other half whole, with seeds. With this mill, I had to process the whole batch - all the berries - in order to sufficiently reduce the number of seeds. Didn't take too long, and we are very happy with the resulting product.
customer_reviews.author: Chena

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T DO THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: The pushers do not make contact with the mill blades, so the food just slides underneath and gets pushed in circles and up the sides. No matter which blade I use there is an 1/8th inch gap, and there is no cutting surface on the holes so unless the food is already mush NOTHING gets milled!! Very disappointed. Otherwise it's a nice machine, solid, easy to clean, just doesn't work!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as Described!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I never though I'd need this but I've been making elderberry syrup and have been trying to get as much liquid out of the berries. This speed up the process which ends in me taking what is left over from the food mill and using a cheese cloth twisted a million times to extract every little ounce humanly possible. This is easy to assemble, a little clumsy to clean, but I read it's dishwasher safe, which I haven't done. I prefer to clean this guy by hand.
customer_reviews.author: paula sparks

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to use this with berries, tomatoes, and cherries. It did not push through that well, I ended up using a food processor instead. Easy to assemble and clean, just not what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn MK

customer_reviews.title: Almost acceptable
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this mill is that the food keeps sliding OVER the holes in the grate rather than being pushed THROUGH the holes. This is because, unlike proper grates, the holes in these grates have smooth rounded edges, which do not bite into and hold the food as it is being pushed around over the holes. After taking the grate to the basement and re-punching about 100 holes from the bottom of the grate, I was able to finish making my apple sauce. Don't buy this unless you are prepared for a good deal of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a few of times, but it worked very well, seems good and sturdy, and I love the interchangeable discs. I also used it (without the handle and with an addition mesh filter), to cold-filter my raw honey! Oh, and did I mention the outstanding price? Other food mills I found at the stores (and online) were double the price I paid for this, and did not have the interchangeable discs! Yes, I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! It came quickly, and is so easy to use. I wish I'd bought it years ago. I love making apple sauce, however I've dreaded cutting the apples up and taking out all the seeds, stems etc. With this handy tool I simply cut the apples in half, cook them on the stove, let them cool and put them in this tool. It is meditative to use. All the good stuff gets pushed through, all the stems and yuck stay out.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie S

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, easy to clean, not worth the buy. I was going to mill chick peas the blade didn't even reach the food. Did not work for me at all. I ended up having to use a blender-not the same thing. Maybe it'll work for you. Not great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't push food through
customer_reviews.text: I tried to mill mushy thawed blackberries from the freezer in order to remove the seeds and it didn't push the fruit through the sieve at all. If it can't handle thawed blackberries I can't imagine it would do a good job at anything else either.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for making home made applesauce
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make applesauce and it worked great and arrived quickly. Super easy to clean, too.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Peyton Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Smaill but durable
customer_reviews.text: I had a more expensive one from La Sur Table that was nearly impossible for me to assemble/disassemble due to arthritis. This little baby is a cinch. Love the different size blades. Made perfect applesauce & decent mashed potatoes. I usually use a ricer but it is difficult for me because I have tiny hands as well. This mill has a different blade than others I have looked at but works fine. It is a bit small (reason for 4 stars) but gets the job done. Washes easily & is well made stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: MnMs

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on apples
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a device that would grind apples, cooked, for sauce. Hard to turn, constantly came loose from the bottom....frankly didn't didn't do the job. Used once had so many problems bought something else
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: am i doing something wrong
customer_reviews.text: it does not grind ANYTHING i put in it. I'm so disappointed i threw away the box, i would've returned it.
customer_reviews.author: PachaMama

customer_reviews.title: Not great for potatoes
customer_reviews.text: It has a nice weight to it and doesn't feel cheap so I had high hopes. I have used many mills in the past, but this one did not work well for my potatoes. Barely anything came through the the largest milling disc. I wouldn't recommend for potatoes. I can see it working well for wetter items though.... just haven't tried.
customer_reviews.author: Lyss Matias

customer_reviews.title: but it is the best tool I have for that purpose and
customer_reviews.text: It worked to my expectations. The only real con was that it is difficult to clean. It has a few nooks and crannies that are hard to get at even by the dishwasher. I used it to separate the seeds from the pulp on persimmons. It is a messy process, but it is the best tool I have for that purpose and, next year, I will try it on pawpaws.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gessner

customer_reviews.title: No-go for Romas
customer_reviews.text: Tried to process Roma Tomatoes. Just pushes the food around and the only food that does go through the mill are the seeds that it's supposed to be keeping out!! I wish I had listened to the negative reviews. Would give this 0 stars. Sent back. Deciding on either a more expensive model or going back to doing it all by hand. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the rave reviews, I bought this. It simply does not work. It doesn't make contact enough to push even potatoes through. It's in the garage in the goodwill box.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Rose

customer_reviews.title: Makes creamy mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: Used this time make mashed potatoes this year for Thanksgiving, best mashed potatoes I ever made. They were smooth and creamy, not gummy at all. Will use it again for sure and try it with other recipes too. Pretty easy to use but my husband helped hold the bowl while I milked the potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design, Food Slides Underneath
customer_reviews.text: Can't really grind any food if there is a quarter inch of space between the blade and the grate. Food just slides beneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Blue's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality....Almost
customer_reviews.text: Works well, seems like good qualify BUT it's been less than 2 years and used it 3 times and the metal hook holding it together popped off and looks like it might have been lighly glued on. Really surprising since it seems quite well built otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Food Mill Makes the Job Pretty Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This food mill is very well-made and functions just as is described. I was working with crab apples so there was a lot of waste that had to be cleaned out regularly. However, it was very simple to do so and it made the job of making applesauce so much easier. I recommend this product for those who Understand it is not automatic and does require a little bit of extra work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work very well!
customer_reviews.text: I got it to mash cooked apples into pulp for apple butter. It just moved the apples all around, didn't do much of anything. I tried it twice, made sure I had everything put together correctly, made sure the apples were soft...Nope. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful well made product
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful well made product. I would have given it 5 starts if it had some way to support it on the bowl beneath it. Some notches in the lower rim would help provide some stability during use. The finest blade caught all but a few tomato seeds and made a nice smooth sauce.This is light years away from pushing it through a strainer with a spatula! On to the applesauce.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble and use. I love it for applesauce and tomato sauce. I like the 3 different screens for different consistency.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I made some applesauce today, cooked up some apples with little bit of water and then once they were soft put them in the food mill. It worked like a charm, I am so happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B

customer_reviews.title: New and improved, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like the stainless steel I had and OLD one that rusted. I like the screen sizes I wish it would squeeze the food a bit more though
customer_reviews.author: MARLYS R. VANENGEN

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Used the small sieve to crush tomatoes for juice and canning. I like the small flag on one of the arms of the retaining bar that keeps skin and seeds from accumulating.
customer_reviews.author: J-6

customer_reviews.title: I am hoping more practice makes me better at using it
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to get the hang of this. It takes so long to get the stuff through. I bought to make NO lump mashed patatoes and it worked but took forever. I am hoping more practice makes me better at using it. I saw it on one of the cooking shows and they made it look so easy. It is not.
customer_reviews.author: toughteach

customer_reviews.title: I got this because Alton Brown recommended it and uses it in his video on mashed ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because Alton Brown recommended it and uses it in his video on mashed potatoes. It works perfectly and is fairly priced. Easy to clean. Fits inside other pots for space-saving storage. Many times this is faster than electric food processors and does a better job on certain things. Versatile. Eco-friendly. Efficient. Deal!
customer_reviews.author: G. ConnerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work as described. I tried using it to mash sweet potatoes and doesn't have a way to mash it through the discs. It just pushed the potatoes around. Wasted money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. Easy cleaning just a little awkward to use. I wish it had a longer handle
customer_reviews.author: gkjkberg

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Have made applesauce and fresh pumpkin pie using ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Have made applesauce and fresh pumpkin pie using this pan to mash and refine the apples and butternut squash. My old pan like this was an antique and badly need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: 22Diva

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to de-seed raspberries for making jam. This did not happen. There is not a disc fine enough with this set to do that. I do love it for other things like making mashed potatoes, tomato sauce squash. Turns potatoes into velvet.
customer_reviews.author: Janice H

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Just did a whole bushel of apples into apple butter and it was fast and easy. Good arm work out. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Augnut

customer_reviews.title: A great accessory for every kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly it is not good for removal of BlackBerry seeds. I am keeping it for other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Spectacular 1

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I used ours to make tomato sauce from our last batch of tomatoes before they went bad. It worked great. They price was excellent for such a nice kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kyote

customer_reviews.title: Strong real Strong
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid piece of machinery. It should last a long time. Quality stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: wayne C.

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: This is a good food meal for a beginner and someone needing it for small proportions. I will have to upgrade to a commercial one as this one it's more work for me with the amount of what I'm trying to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Teyah

customer_reviews.title: Great for all types of food.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this product for anyone to have on hand in the kitchen. Very versatile. light weight. easy to clean and use. I love that it has three different size blades. I had one for years that belonged to my mom and it was one size hole. This will be great for cactus apple jelly, potatoes, can be used as a ricer and for anyone that needs to have help making their food easier to digest, this is the tool!
customer_reviews.author: Kitchenwizard

customer_reviews.title: Just like my Mom's.....
customer_reviews.text: My Mom used to make homemade apple sauce. This like the one she had. It brings back pleasant memories.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Meppie

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great grinding & deseeding my tomatoes and blackberries!
customer_reviews.author: ruthe arie

customer_reviews.title: Can’t use as potato ricer, my fault
customer_reviews.text: I returned as I bought wrong type, I was looking for a potato ricer Nothing wrong with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good item !
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work on beans, lima beans , etc..... It is not a good item .
customer_reviews.author: Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Does exactly what you need it to, easier to clean than the older versions where the plate doesn't come off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this product canning tomatoes was a breeze with this
customer_reviews.author: lynn milliner

customer_reviews.title: missing something
customer_reviews.text: Better than peeling but I had to make a few adjustments to this to make the tomatoes not come up and over the middle. Its like its missing a piece. it does do most the job and it is better than not having one at all
customer_reviews.author: Anna Banana

customer_reviews.title: Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: Made canning tomato juice so much easier. I got an extra 2-3 quarts of juice from using mill.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Wilcher

customer_reviews.title: Warm soups for fall
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has weight to it so that its easier to manage
customer_reviews.author: Randy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It works well on blackberries. Not messy, easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Kj

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Not great. I was able to use this with lentils only.. does does work for tomatoes, or peas... for the price I would have expected better
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this....easier to use them the older one I have
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Saves lots of time.
customer_reviews.text: Similar to the one my mom had 60 years ago. I use this for my red chili pods when I make my red chili sauce. Saves hours. Easy to clean. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Thin and feels like will fall apart when using
customer_reviews.text: Cheap very cheaply made. Thin and feels like will fall apart when using.
customer_reviews.author: EJ_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for small batches.
customer_reviews.text: All in all a good product. My only suggestion is to have a scraper on the bottom to clean it while you are using it. This product is great for small amounts. With my huge family it is time consuming to get enough product through it. It is well made and easy to change the screens out.
customer_reviews.author: William Dale

customer_reviews.title: Change directions
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say to turn the handle counter-clockwise. If that doesn't work for you, try turning the handle clockwise.
customer_reviews.author: rckymtn7

customer_reviews.title: This very old school technology works as well today as ...
customer_reviews.text: This very old school technology works as well today as it did in the 1900's. The fact that this is stainless steel makes it a no brainer for anyone looking for a simple yet time proven way to filter or pureee foods.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Inneffective
customer_reviews.text: Making applesauce should be easy, right? Without something to secure the handle from below the grinder often rides above the apples. Much waste, took forever. Wish I had not been so optimistic by throwing away the packaging - would have sent this back.
customer_reviews.author: Tish Paye

customer_reviews.title: Not the best foley
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would replace my ancient one and do a better job. Wrong. Cannot get the Foley close enough to get a smooth grind and it doesn't seem to get enough pulp off the skins. Seeds sneak through the finest disc.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: It's a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a great kitchen tool & works very Well!
customer_reviews.author: phil samuelson

customer_reviews.title: Good for baby food perhaps
customer_reviews.text: It was not sturdy enough to purée apples. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P. Yafchak

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Uses
customer_reviews.text: I am used to the wooden grinder, but the steel one can be used for multiple purposes. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works great but we should have exchanged ours.
customer_reviews.text: The mill works great but out of the box the outer metal was a bit jagged and even sharp where the brackets are welded on to the pan. We didn't return it because we were too damn excited to start making applesauce so I don't have any comments (or complaints) on how they handle returns. I would have only asked for an exchange since the product works great!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Really big
customer_reviews.text: This was entirely too big I was searching for a good mill to grind baby food.
customer_reviews.author: mmiller

customer_reviews.title: Useless for mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mash potatoes for Easter. It was useless. I had to scrape out the potatoes and mash them with my old fashioned masher. Don't waste your time or money if you are planning on using it for potatoes mostly. Can't speak to other uses so maybe it is helpful for the other food types but I'm not willing to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: B
customer_reviews.text: I bought to can cherry tomatos...to grind Out the seeds and skins.....didn’t work at all
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money. Saves lots of time.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I made pear butter in a fraction of the time that it traditionally took me. I've since made tomato sauce, exaggerated spicy ketchup, and amazing hot sauce. It's easy to assemble, use, and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would like to see a tension adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: The tension doesn't seem to be adjustable unless I just don't know how to do it. It works ok but my old one actually worked much better. It's just that my old one got a little rusty. I doubt this one will ever rust so it'll do!
customer_reviews.author: jowest

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use for mashed potatoes and it did not work. It was really hard to turn and the potatoes just got jammed up......it would not go through the holes. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer lane

customer_reviews.title: Awkward
customer_reviews.text: Hard to crank even with just a few berries in it, they dont break down easily. Everything about it Is just awkward
customer_reviews.author: Everett F Perkins

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Better than expected. I set it in a slightly smaller pot and hold both handles and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gapepper

customer_reviews.title: Weston food mill
customer_reviews.text: Looked all over for this item; no longer sold in hardware stores. I told myself that I was going to get one and that's when I decided to check out Amazon and sure enough there it was. I've used it and it reminds me of old times. A little bit of hand exercised never hurt anyone. Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Theresa A. Monsanto

customer_reviews.title: doesn't do the job
customer_reviews.text: I grew up using a food mill so I know how to use it and I know what to expect. This does not meet expectations. The blades do not go all the way down to the strainer part and thus do not effectively force the food through.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work for tomatoes at all. All the seeds went through the smallest holes disk and it wouldn’t push the tomato pulp through. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Rushton

customer_reviews.title: SoSo
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I really like this thing but I really needed it to make Ketchup. Sad I have to keep it. Invest and buy one of better quality
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: The item was just what I expected. It works very well.
customer_reviews.text: The item was just what I expected. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Slater

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Quality built product and I use often for tomatoes, apples, and other fruits to gather the seeds for storage
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Robitaille

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use. It has a few grinding plate options, which is nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: AMR

customer_reviews.title: and is better than i expected
customer_reviews.text: Ease to use, and is better than i expected, good for me
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Love this food mill! Made spaghetti sauce and mashed potatoes, best mashed potatoes I've ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: The product didn’t work well. It wouldn’t grind the food enough to make it useful. I was very unhappy with it! Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine4me

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Made it so much easier to make apple sauce without having to peel the apples
customer_reviews.author: donna lepage

customer_reviews.title: Exactly product
customer_reviews.text: I used this item to make tomato juice. It worked exactly as it was stated.
customer_reviews.author: Ida B.

customer_reviews.title: Pushes food around, not through
customer_reviews.text: Overall nice, solid construction, but two fatal flaws: 1) the blade of the mill does not make contact with the disk and 2) the surface of the disk is very smooth. Because of this, food only gets pushed around the mill and doesn't effectively get pushed through. I have tried putting several different foods (including diced tomatoes, roasted peppers, and cooked potatoes) through all sizes of the disks. With effort, some food does make it through, but the majority of it just gets pushed around leaving a lot of waste and mess. I have used a friend's OXO Good Grips food mill which works MUCH better, but it is also more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This this is amazing!!! It takes no time to squeeze tomatoes and very high quality made
customer_reviews.author: Theresa West

customer_reviews.title: I made a mistake and all is well, seller is great.
customer_reviews.text: At first I had some trouble but it was my fault not the sellers!! Seller was very kind and understanding, I would definetly do business with this seller again
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy with this product
customer_reviews.text: This was one big waste of money. I wanted it specifically for making mashed potatoes. After the mess I ended up with, I will stick with Potato buds from the box. I will donate this to the Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Five minutes to assemble and a breeze to use!
customer_reviews.text: This food mill is a breeze to put together and use. It took all of 5 minutes from the time I opened the box to be ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Ellis

customer_reviews.title: No Pressure
customer_reviews.text: When put together the blades and dome don't meet so no pressure is there to push food through. Couldn't get through boiled tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: OwlEyeBooks

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: The blade does not go down far enough so the food is trapped and does not get processed
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: It' OK.
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsy, so I don't know hoe much I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Poohie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: From half a bushel of tomatoes to tomato juice in short order. Easy to assemble, easy to clean and sturdy. I love having three sizes for the strainers. It arrived just in time for summer home garden harvest.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Quacker

product_meta.title: Weston Stainless Steel Food Mill , 2 Quart Capacity, 3 Milling Discs, Dishwasher Safe
product_meta.description: The Weston Stainless Steel food mill is great for making sauces, purees, soups, jams, jellies, mashed potatoes, baby foods and spatzle. Also will mash and sieve soft foods. It has a approximate 2-Quart (1. Liter) Capacity, and is easy to clean and dishwasher safe. Includes 3 Stainless Steel milling discs to process any soft food.
feature_bullets: Three Stainless Steel milling discs: fine (2 mm), medium (3 mm) and coarse (8 mm)
included components: Weston 61-0101-W Stainless Steel Food Mill
Includes 3 stainless steel milling discs that prevent pulp and skins from slipping through: 2mm fine milling disc; 3mm medium milling disc; 8mm coarse milling disc

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars809 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
